column4: hey everyone, i was in here yesterday with a grub problem on 9.10 of grub not finding windows 7. i researched it a bit more, but no solutions have worked.
has anyone had a similar problem?
could anyone help me out? i really dont want to lose my windows install..
Alright: Just installed 9.10 onto a system with Windows 7. Grub is not recognizing Win7, therefore I cannot boot into it. I have tried many solution, but nothing seems to work.
did it create an entry for windows 7 ?
whats the output of upgrate-grub can you post it to pastebin
did you resize the windows partition in order to install ubuntu?
win7 is /dev/sda1 and ubuntu /dev/sda2 (or lower) ?, can you access the win7 disk from ubuntu?
can you access the windows disk from ubuntu
it should be visibile under places
you can try to manually mount /dev/sda1
the problem is your windows install is a bit dysfunctional
what you need to do is boot a win7 disc, run recovery and do a disk check, this will destroy grub again(yay), but afterwards you can boot the livecd of ubuntu and fix grub again
there are some shortcuts to be made , but this is the most foolproof approach i can recommend, fix window7 and make sure it boots, then fix grub
also refer to the dualboot wiki on recovering ubuntu after installing windows
